abstract.text: Override methods to handle user-initiated actions.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: When the user performs an action in the document browser (for example, moving, renaming, or deleting an item) the system calls the corresponding method on your
subclass.
The following table shows the action method for each action type:
User action
Action method
Creates a new folder
Deletes a document or folder
Imports a document
Renames a document or folder
Moves a document or folder
Sets or changes a folderâ€™s favorite rank
Uses a document
Tags or untags a document or folder
Moves a document or folder to the trash
Removes a document or folder from the trash
When the action method is called, ensure that your implementation:
Makes any necessary local changes, including updates to the working set
Schedules a background update for your server
Signals that the changes have occurred
Calls the completion handler with the results

All the action methods are expected to work offline, and should return immediately. Call the completion handler before performing any network activity or other long-running tasks. Defer these tasks to the background.

abstract.text: An extension other apps use to access files and folders managed by your app and synced with a remote storage.
The principal class for the nonreplicated File Provider extension.
Creates a directory with the given name inside the given parent directory.
Permanently deletes an item from the trash.
Imports a file or package into the given parent directory.
Moves the specified item into the given parent directory.
Marks a directory as a favorite and sets its relative order in the Favorites list.
Marks an item as recently used and sets its relative order in the Recents list.
Moves an item into the trash.
Moves an item out of the trash.
Handle any errors that occur while processing the action.
Build a File Provider extension that hosts and manages the userâ€™s local files.
Signal the system about any changes created by an action.
